choices.D: VMware vSphere Storage APIs Array Integration (VAAI)
choices.C: VMware vStorage APIs for Data Protection (VADP)

questions.question_text: Which vSphere APIs support storage hardware acceleration?

discussion.content: VMware vSphere® Storage APIs – Array Integration (VAAI), also referred to as hardware acceleration or hardware offload APIs, are a set of APIs to enable communication between VMware vSphere ESXi™ hosts and storage devices

choices.D: VM is in a suspended state.
choices.C: VM is running on a snapshot.

questions.question_text:
A vSphere administrator discovers the size of the .vswp file for a VM with 2 vCPUs and 4GB of memory is zero.
What could be the cause?

discussion.content:
D is Correct.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.7/com.vmware.vsphere.security.doc/GUID-DFC745FB-CDD6-4828-8948-4D0E0561EEF8.html

To secure iSCSI devices, require that the ESXi host, or initiator, can authenticate to the iSCSI device, or target, whenever the host attempts to access data on the target LUN.

questions.question_text: Which action should be taken to secure ISCSI devices in a vSphere environment?

choices.B: Require ESXi hosts to use ISCSI port binding.
choices.D: Require ESXi hosts to authentication to the target.

discussion.content:
A is correct, VDS is configured at Datacenter level.
B,C,D are available in VSS as well.
E. States that the port associated with the VM migrates to the new host along with the VM. With a VSS the port binding is removed (as VSS is local to each host) and when the VM is on its new host a new port binding is created with the local VSS. As a VDS is distributed across all hosts, there is no need to remove and recreate a binding.

choices.D: Uplinks are allowed to be configured in an Active/Standby configuration.
choices.B: There is IPv6 support for a VDS.
choices.A: Data center setup and administration are simplified by centralizing network configuration.

questions.question_text: What are two advantages of deploying a VDS as compared to a VSS? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Unregister and register the virtual machine in vCenter Server.
choices.C: Migrate the machine to another host with vSphere vMotion.
choices.D: Migrate the machine to another datastore with Storage vMotion.

A vSphere administrator has renamed the inventory name of a virtual machine.
Which task should the administrator perform to ensure the virtual machine files are also renamed to match the new virtual machine name?
